column3: # Nsim : Number of simulated stocks (
# SimYear : total number of years in simulation
# InitYear : year in which the MSE starts (i.e. the number of years for which there are data going into the first assessment)
# AssessmentType : 0=No assessment, 1=Production, 2=Age-structured)
# FisheryIndepenDat : Included fishery independent survey in assessment?
# LifeHistoryPlots : Plot the life history?
# EstimationPlots : Plot the diagnostics for each assessment run? (changes by assessment)
# AssessmentData : plot the data for assessment
# PlotYieldCurve : plot the yield curve? 1= yes, 0 = no, this takes a while, so only do if needed
# CatchCVn : CV of catch in Box 1
# CPUEcvN : CV of CPUE in Box 1
# IndexCVn : CV of survey in Box 1
# LenSampleN : Number of length samples from box 1
# LengthBinN : number of length bins used for the assessment
# MaxAge : maximum age
# NatMn : natural mortality, c(rep(0.16,35),rep(.24,16))
# VonKn : Von Bertalannfy K
# LinfN : Maximum length (L infinity)
# t0n : t zero in Von Bert
# GrowthSDn : standard deviation of growth in box 1
# mat50n : age at 50% maturity
# mat95n : age at 95% maturity
# alphaN : alpha in weight at length (a*L^b)
# betaN : beta  in weight at length (a*L^b)
# MaxMovingN : maximum proportion moving by age (scales a logistic curve)
# Move50n : age at 50% moving (before application of scaling by maximum proportion moving at age)
# Move95n : age at 95% moving (before application of scaling by maximum proportion moving at age)
# steepnessN : stock recruit parameter
# sigmaRn : variability around the recruitment curve
# RzeroN : virgin recruitment
# sel50n : length at 50% selection in the fishery
# sel95n : length at 95% selection in the fishery
# surv50n : length at 50% selection in the survey
# surv95n : length at 95% selection in the survey
# HistoricalFn : fishing mortality over the historic period (i.e. the number of years designated as the year in which the MSE starts above)
# PastFsdN : standard deviation applied to HistoricalF to generate stochastic past fishing mortality
# HarvestControlN : 1 = FMSY; 2 = constant catch, 3 = constant F; 4 = 40/10,
# ConstantCatchN : if above ==2, this sets the constant catch
# ConstantFn : if above == 3, this sets the constant F applied
# HCalphaN : this defines the slope of the control rule
# HCbetaN : this defines the proportion of target biomass at which no fishing occurs

column1: #==If a second population is modeled, the below must be filled in
#==if life history is identical to pop 1, copy and paste

column3: # TwoPop : if >0, two populations are modeled
# NatMs : natural mortality , c(rep(0.16,35),rep(.24,16))
# VonKs : Von Bertalannfy K
# LinfS : Maximum length (L infinity)
# t0s : t zero in Von Bert
# GrowthSDs : standard deviation of growth in box 2
# mat50s : age at 50% maturity
# mat95s : age at 95% maturity
# alphaS : alpha in weight at length (a*L^b)
# betaS : beta  in weight at length (a*L^b)
# MaxMovingS : maximum proportion moving by age (scales a logistic curve)
# Move50s : age at 50% moving (before application of scaling by maximum proportion moving at age)
# Move95s : age at 95% moving (before application of scaling by maximum proportion moving at age)
# steepnessS : stock recruit parameter
# sigmaRs : variability around the recruitment curve
# RzeroS : virgin recruitment
# sel50s : length at 50% selection in the fishery
# sel95s : length at 95% selection in the fishery
# surv50s : length at 50% selection in the survey
# surv95s : length at 95% selection in the survey
# CatchCVs : CV of catch in Box 2
# CPUEcvS : CV of CPUE in Box 2
# IndexCVs : CV of survey in Box 2
# LenSampleS : Number of length samples from box 2
# LengthBinS : number of length bins used for the assessment
# HistoricalFs : fishing mortality over the historic period (i.e. the number of years designated as the year in which the MSE starts above)
# PastFsdS : standard deviation applied to HistoricalF to generate stochastic past fishing mortality
# HarvestControlS : 1 = FMSY; 2 = constant catch, 3 = constant F; 4 = 40/10,
# ConstantCatchS : if above ==2, this sets the constant catch
# ConstantFs : if above == 3, this sets the constant F applied
# HCalphaS : this defines the slope of the control rule
# HCbetaS : this defines the proportion of target biomass at which no fishing occurs
# SmallNum : a small number added to log calculations to avoid taking the log of zero
# InitSmooth : smoothness for initial size comps
# FmortPen : a smoothness penalty for F
# RecruitPen : a smoothness penalty for Recruitment devs
# EstM : should M be estimated? If positive, indicates the phase to estimate, if negative, M is not estimated
# TimeVaryM : should a time-varying M be estimated? 1 = yes, 0 = no
# Mpenalty : smoothness penalty on estimated natural mortality devs
# EstGrowthK : should growth be estimated (Linf and K); positive indictes the phase to estimate; negative means do not estimate
# TimeVaryGrowthK : should growth be time-varying when estimated? If positive, indicates phase to estimate, if negative, not estimated.
# EstLinf : should growth be estimated (Linf and K); positive indictes the phase to estimate; negative means do not estimate
# TimeVaryLinf : should growth be time-varying when estimated? If positive, indicates phase to estimate, if negative, not estimated.
# Growthpenalty : smoothness penalty on estimated growth devs
# TimeVarySel50 : is time varying selectivity eestimated?? Negative number == no; positive number == phase in which estimation occurs
# TimeVarySel95 : is time varying selectivity eestimated?? Negative number == no; positive number == phase in which estimation occurs
# SelPenalty : smoothness penalty on estimated selectivity devs
# ProjectTimeVary : how many years to average over at the end of the estimated time series of the timevarying process for projections?
# InitValSig : standard deviation for how much to jitter starting parameters for the .pin file
# InitBzeroMod : determines what fraction the true Bzero is multiplied by for an initial value for estimation
# InitGrowthRate : initial value for intrinsic growth rate in production model estimation
